definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

sentences.english: Then they made us sit on our knees again for more than two hours while they whipped us.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们又跪着被他们用皮鞭抽打了两个多小时。

sentences.english: Whips and sex aides often factor in the plotlines.
sentences.chinese: 皮鞭和各种性具常常会出现在这些影片的主要情节中。

sentences.english: The slaves writhed under the master's whip.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶们被奴隶主的皮鞭打得在地上打滚。

sentences.english: I gave my horse a lash that sounded through the forest.
sentences.chinese: 我给了我的马一皮鞭，那声音响彻森林。

sentences.english: He leathered the slave black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 他用皮鞭把奴隶抽打得浑身青一块紫一块。

sentences.english: But I remembered him and the leather crop swinging from his belt.
sentences.chinese: 但是我记得他和他皮带上晃悠的皮鞭。

sentences.english: In the chimney-corner a cat-o'-nine-tails was hanging on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 壁炉角上，挂着一根皮鞭。

sentences.english: whips  tied  to the  inside  lining. 'You  brought  The  Persuaders.
sentences.chinese: 我解开外套，给他看系在内衬上的两根皮鞭。

definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
